thread.title: NPA Honors Gary Pohrer with Harwood Leadership & Legends Award

author: cnbc.com
title: NPA Honors Gary Pohrer with Harwood Leadership & Legends Award
text:
WASHINGTON, Feb. 7, 2018 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Yesterday, the National Parking Association (NPA) honored Gary Pohrer of the St. Louis Parking Company with the parking industry's highest honor, the Brett Harwood Leadership & Legends Award. The award was presented to Pohrer at the NPA Winter Leadership Forum. This prestigious national honor recognizes lifelong leadership, excellence and integrity.
"The NPA Board of Directors selected Pohrer as the 2018 honoree for his dedication to professionalism and integrity," said NPA President Christine Banning, MA, CAE. Banning added, "Gary Pohrer has been a lifelong parking leader and positive influence on the industry, respected by his peers. The Pohrer family are founding members of NPA."
The award was presented to Pohrer, on behalf of the NPA, by Mark Muglich, past NPA board chair and former president of ABM Parking Services. Of Pohrer, Mark said, "Gary has worked in the parking industry since 1958. He has been a great mentor and inspiration to many at the NPA, including me. He has supported the NPA foundation, the industry and served as a mentor to many through the years. "
Gary Pohrer is currently co-chairman of St. Louis Parking Company, alongside his brother, Jack Pohrer. St Louis Parking Company is a three generation family-owned business founded by Gary Pohrer's father, Edward F. Pohrer, in 1933. Edward Pohrer served as NPA board chair from 1960-1962.
Gary Pohrer is a long-time member of NPA and served as a member of the board. He entered the parking industry in 1958 and has been active in all facets of the business, with emphasis on financial analysis, development and operations. He is also a former member of Downtown St. Louis Partnership where he has served on the Traffic and Security Committee and Riverfront Development Committee and is a past recipient of the prestigious Levee Stone Award. Pohrer also served on the Central West End Association Board of Directors. He is a member of BOMA (Building Owners and Managers Association) and the Clayton Chamber of Commerce. Pohrer is a graduate of Saint Louis University High School and Holy Cross College.
St. Louis Parking Company manages, owns and leases over 100 parking facilities consisting of over 57,000 parking spaces. Its facilities are supported by a team of parking professionals consisting of 50 managers, supervisors and as well as over 350 hourly associates available to meet the demands in the St. Louis area.
About the Award : The Board of Directors of NPA established the Brett Harwood Leadership & Legends Award in 2013 to honor lifetime achievement in parking industry leadership. Pohrer is the fifth recipient of the award and was honored February 6th at the association's Winter Leadership Forum.
About NPA: Founded in 1951, the National Parking Association is the voice of the $29 billion parking industry that employs more than 143,000 individuals. NPA is the leading trade association for the parking industry in North America representing the interests of public and private parking sector leaders and professionals. NPA provides research, advocacy, professional development and credentialing to its members. To learn more, visit NPA at WeAreParking.org .
